content: This exposition, thorough and multi-faceted, is a stunner, particularly for one spanning generations (I was born in 1940, and went on to help defeat Hitler); we witness a society in turmoil, one completely unprepared for such astonishing shifts of influence. Just read (on Dmitry Orlov’s blog, if I’m not mistaken) that there is a vast comedy scene today in Russia, with jokesters poking fun at the contemporary weirdness in Norteamerica. Underlying the laughter, however, there is said to be alarm. Many Russians think America has gone insane.
